org.jscsi.parser

Class AbstractMessageParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jscsi.parser.AbstractMessageParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InitiatorMessageParser, TargetMessageParser

    public abstract class AbstractMessageParser
extends Object

    AbstractMessageParser

    Abstract class from which each parser (initiator or target message parser) for a specific Protocol Data Unit (PDU) is inherited. The version of iSCSI Protocol is the RFC3720.

    Author:
    Volker Wildi

    • Field Detail

      • protocolDataUnit

        protected final ProtocolDataUnit protocolDataUnit
        The read-only reference to the ProtocolDataUnit instance, which contains this AbstractMessageParser type.

      • logicalUnitNumber

        protected long logicalUnitNumber
        Some opcodes operate on a specific Logical Unit. The Logical Unit Number (LUN) field identifies which Logical Unit. If the opcode does not relate to a Logical Unit, this field is either ignored or may be used in an opcode specific way. The LUN field is 64-bits and should be formatted in accordance with [SAM2]. For example, LUN[0] from [SAM2] is BHS byte 8 and so on up to LUN[7] from [SAM2], which is BHS byte 15.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMessageParser

        public AbstractMessageParser(ProtocolDataUnit initProtocolDataUnit)
        Default Contructor to create a new, empty AbstractMessageParser object.
        Parameters:
        initProtocolDataUnit - The reference ProtocolDataUnit instance, which contains this AbstractMessageParser object.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataSegmentFormat

        public abstract DataSegmentFactory.DataSegmentFormat getDataSegmentFormat()
        If this method returns true, hen it indicates that the data segment data is interpreted as binary data. Else the data segment data must be interpreted as Text Format.
        Returns:
        Returns a format defined by the DataSegmentFormat enumeration.
        See Also:
        DataSegmentFactory.DataSegmentFormat

      • canContainAdditionalHeaderSegments

        public boolean canContainAdditionalHeaderSegments()
        If this method returns true, it indicates that this derived AbstractMessageParser can contain one or more Additional Header Segments.
        Returns:
        Returns true, if this AbstractMessageParser object can contain one or more AHSs.
        See Also:
        AdditionalHeaderSegment

      • canHaveDigests

        public boolean canHaveDigests()
        If this method returns true, then it indicates that this derived AbstractMessageParser instance can be protected by a digest.
        Returns:
        true, if the ProtocolDataUnit can be protected by a header and/or a data digest. Else false.

      • getShortInfo

        public abstract String getShortInfo()
        Returns the short version of the used sequence numbers of this parser instance.
        Returns:
        The string with all needed sequence numbers.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        This method concatenate all the fields of a derived parser to allow an easy generation of debug informations.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The debug formatted string.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        This method sets all settings to their initial values.

      • incrementSequenceNumber

        public abstract boolean incrementSequenceNumber()
        This AbstractMessageParser instance affects the incrementation of a Sequence Number counter.
        Returns:
        true, if the counter has to be incremented.

      • checkIntegrity

        protected abstract void checkIntegrity()
                                throws InternetSCSIException
        This method checks, if all parsed fields are valid. Because there are several fields, which are reserved for future versions, and these must be zero. Is this the case an exception will be thrown.
        Throws:
        InternetSCSIException - If the integrity is violated.
